newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi Arabia launches first locally made missile.
newsitem.headline: Saudi Arabia launches first locally made missile.

text.p: Saudi Arabia has test fired its first domestically produced surface-to-surface missile during the inauguration of a military complex, the official Saudi Press Agency (SPA) reported.
Saudi Defence Minister Prince Sultan fired the missile on Saturday at the complex in Kharj, 100 km (60 miles) southeast of Riyadh.
"The missile which was launched today (Saturday)...has a range of 35 to 60 km (21 to 37 miles)," Saudi Defence Minister Prince Sultan said, as quoted by SPA.
Saudi newspapers had reported earlier that the missile was manufactured by the ammunition maintenance centre and ammunition school at the base in Kharj.
Saudi Arabia has an ambitious armament programme and major arms contracts with Britain, the United States and France.
